title: Unusually geometric 'a'
content:
There might have been a tail, but it wasnt there in the source.  
The rest of the form is quite unusual, so maybe someone will know.  
Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [a.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091043/http:/typophile.com/files/a_0.png) | 11.37 KB |

 [‹ Pulp Fantasy Cover ID Needed](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091043/http:/typophile.com/node/33783 "Go to previous forum topic") [Veer Web Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091043/http:/typophile.com/node/33784 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Paul-Kenji Cahier

comments.content:
Here is some more...  
It might not be the same font, but I suspect it is(they were all close together)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091043im_/http:/typophile.com/files/add_5164.png)

I fount it!  
Cyclops regular, (the info marked is 1998 e-val monkeys/holly\_M)  
the smaller a was a modified version.

I couldnt find any info about it on the web so this version I have could be a copy...

If anyone has more info, I’d be glad to hear about it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070716091043im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CyclopsRegular_6550.png)
To the mods(or whoever changes the titles), please mark this as solved.
